item.title: Today’s Wordle #1600: Hints And Answer For November 5, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Get ready for an easier Wordle answer than the past few days. Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1600 on November 5, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, November 5, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1600 is going to be easier to solve than the past few puzzles. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 3.8 of 6 guesses. That makes it lower than the 5.2-guess average on November 4.

General Wordle Hints For November 5

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • THORS
  • SHOUT
  • STORM

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1600 for November 5, 2025

Starter Words For November 5, 2025

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • Hint 1: This word contains only one vowel.
  • Hint 2: It has more consonants than vowels.
  • Hint 3: It can refer to something being limited or lacking in length or duration.
  • Hint 4: It’s the opposite of long.

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1600 On November 5, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: SHORT

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1599 on November 4, 2025:

Answer: VENUE

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1600?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on November 6 will be Wordle Game #1601.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

Need more help with other daily games? Let us know what games you’d like tips and clues for in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Games for November 2025 Wave 1 Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Xbox Game Pass Wave 1 for November 2025 will feature 11 new games, with several Day One releases and the highly anticipated Call of Duty: Black Ops 7.

Several players will be looking for Xbox Game Pass titles for November 2025, as the highly anticipated Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 will be offered as a Day One title. As Xbox adds new titles, several old titles are also being removed from the subscription service, and it appears that Stalker 2 and four other games will be leaving this month. However, let’s start by discussing all the new games coming to Xbox Game Pass.

6 Day One Games Coming to Xbox Game Pass in November Wave 1

Out of the 11 new games we will be receiving through Xbox Game Pass this month, 6 of them are Day One titles. Apart from Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, players can expect Day One games like Dead Static Drive, Egging On, Winter Burrow, Pigeon Simulator, and more. Along with these, players can look forward to some really popular titles as well, including Sniper Elite: Resistance, Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris, and more.

Check out all the new games coming to Xbox Game Pass in November, including their dates and platforms:

  • Dead Static Drive – Cloud, Console, and PC on November 5 (Day One)
  • Sniper Elite Resistance – Cloud, Console, and PC on November 5
  • Egging On – Cloud, Console, and Xbox Series X/S on November 6 (Day One)
  • Whiskerwood – PC on November 6 (Day One)
  • Voidtrain – Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S on November 7
  • Great God Above – Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S on November 11
  • Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris – Cloud, Console, and PC on November 11
  • Pigeon Simulator – Cloud, PC, and Xbox Series X/S on November 11 (Day One)
  • Relic Hunters Legend – Cloud, Console, and PC on November 12
  • Winter Burrow – Cloud, Console, and PC on November 12 (Day One)
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 – Cloud, Console, and PC on November 14 (Day One)

In other news, Call of Duty developers think Xbox Game Pass price hike is ‘a positive‘. Additionally, Halo MMO was reportedly cancelled to protect an Xbox exec’s bonus. What are your thoughts on the Xbox Game Pass Wave 1 games for November 2025? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Nintendo’s patent in Palworld dispute is being reexamined by the US Patent Office. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Nintendo’s Patent in Palworld Dispute is Being Reexamined by USPTO
item.content:encoded:
A significant development has transpired in Nintendo’s patent infringement lawsuit against Palworld, as one of their patents is being reexamined by the US Patent Office.

For those wondering, in September 2025, Nintendo acquired a patent amid its lawsuit against Palworld. The patent in question, US Patent No. 12,403,397, relates to summoning characters and allowing them to engage in combat against one another. Now, the USPTO director has personally ordered the office to reexamine the patent.

Nintendo’s Patent Against Palworld is Being Reexamined Due to Two Prior Art References

According to a report by GamesFray, USPTO Director John A. Squires has personally ordered, at his own initiative, that the organisation reexamines Nintendo’s patent against Palworld due to two older US patent applications. US Patent No. 12,403,397’s claims 1, 13, 25, and 26 are the ones under review, and if they fall, then the other ones will fall as well, like “a house of cards.” The reexamination is being conducted due to the failure to cite prior art references in support of the issuance of this patent

The two prior art references have been specified as well. Nintendo’s ‘397 patent is related to character summons in combat, and it seems Konami and Nintendo itself have patents that can be considered prior art. Konami’s patent application was filed in 2001 and published in 2002. The other is Nintendo’s own patent application, which was filed in 2019 and published in 2020. Both of these prior art references “teach a player being allowed to perform a battle in a manual mode and in a simpler, automatic mode.”

For those wondering, reexamination doesn’t mean the patent will be revoked. Nintendo will have two months to come up with a response, and during that time, third parties can also present challenges through other prior art references. Moreover, if Nintendo tries to sue over patent ‘397 in a United States District Court, the “court would stay the proceedings pending the outcome of the reexamination.”

The director initiated the order for Ex Parte Reexamination to address the element that the original examiner believed made Nintendo’s patent distinct from the prior art. Moreover, there might not be any more developments in Nintendo’s lawsuit against Palworld in this calendar year. But, 2026 should see some decisions come into play by Presiding Judge Motoyuki Nakashima.

Regarding the lawsuit, one of Nintendo’s anti-Palworld patents was recently rejected in Japan. Additionally, the Switch 2 has surpassed 10 million units sold. What are your thoughts on Nintendo’s patent in the Palworld dispute being reexamined by the USPTO? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Soulja Boy selling rebranded Retroid consoles as his own. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
